docs.snippet: ISTANBUL, Feb. 15--The Turkish Government has decided not to participate in the New York World's Fair this year owing to a shortage of foreign exchange. However, the Turkish pavilion will remain at the disposal of the Fair.
docs.lead_paragraph: ISTANBUL, Feb. 15--The Turkish Government has decided not to participate in the New York World's Fair this year owing to a shortage of foreign exchange. However, the Turkish pavilion will remain at the disposal of the Fair.
docs.abstract: Turkey, Argentina and Chile not to exhibit; 5 Amer nations of Pan Amer Union group plan own exhibits

headline.main: Turkey Not to Take Part in Fair This Year; Argentina and Chile Also Are Withdrawing

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Feb. 15 (AP)--Brazilian maritime authorities today ordered the German merchantman, the Koenigsberg, to return to her moorings at Para or sail outside territorial waters.
docs.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO, Brazil, Feb. 15 (AP)--Brazilian maritime authorities today ordered the German merchantman, the Koenigsberg, to return to her moorings at Para or sail outside territorial waters.
docs.abstract: Orders German freighter Koenigsberg to return to Para or leave territorial waters because of neutrality law violation

headline.main: NAZI SHIP OFF COAST IS WARNED BY BRAZIL; Koenigsberg Told to Return to Port or Leave Waters

docs.snippet: LONDON, Feb. 15--The cruiser Exeter, which bore the brunt of the battle with the Admiral Graf Spee off Uruguay, arrived in Plymouth, her home port, today to be received by thousands of cheering citizens who lined the shore and service men who manned...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Feb. 15--The cruiser Exeter, which bore the brunt of the battle with the Admiral Graf Spee off Uruguay, arrived in Plymouth, her home port, today to be received by thousands of cheering citizens who lined the shore and service men who manned every ship in the harbor.
docs.abstract: Brit hail cruiser Exeter crew on arrival in Plymouth, Churchill greets crew

headline.main: EXETER WELCOMED BY BRITISH CROWDS; Cruiser That Bore Brunt of Battle With Spee Cheered in Her Home Port PATCHED UP FOR VOYAGE Scars of Fight Still Visible-- Churchill Tells Crew of Nation's Pride

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: ed blaming cold on battle guns
docs.abstract: ed blaming cold on battle guns

docs.snippet: BERGEN, Norway, Feb. 16--The British destroyer Intrepid today seized the German steamer Altmark inside Norwegian territorial waters near here, placed a prize crew aboard and was heading for the open sea when Norwegian warships intervened.
docs.lead_paragraph: BERGEN, Norway, Feb. 16--The British destroyer Intrepid today seized the German steamer Altmark inside Norwegian territorial waters near here, placed a prize crew aboard and was heading for the open sea when Norwegian warships intervened.
docs.abstract: Norwegian warships order Brit prize crew off Altmark after Brit destroyer Intrepid seized it inside Norwegian territorial waters; Brit deny Altmark was attacked; Germany scores Brit for attack on Norway's neutrality

headline.main: PRIZE CREW OUSTED; Torpedo Boats Compel Destroyer to Return Altmark to Captain NAVAL BATTLE GLIMPSED Norwegians Sight Warships in Action Before Pursuit of German Prison Ship

docs.snippet: FROM a war news standpoint, the hours from 7:30 to 8:30  P.M. now are definitely the most interesting on short waves. A composite picture of Europe through its war bulletins is flashed toward America in just an hour's time.
docs.lead_paragraph: FROM a war news standpoint, the hours from 7:30 to 8:30 P.M. now are definitely the most interesting on short waves. A composite picture of Europe through its war bulletins is flashed toward America in just an hour's time.

docs.snippet: LONDON, Feb. 17--Sir Samuel Hoare, Lord Privy Seal, warned in a speech in Nottingham today that unless Britain maintained her export trade she would lose the war. He pointed out the need for buying war supplies abroad with her export trade.
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Feb. 17--Sir Samuel Hoare, Lord Privy Seal, warned in a speech in Nottingham today that unless Britain maintained her export trade she would lose the war. He pointed out the need for buying war supplies abroad with her export trade.
docs.abstract: Lord Chatfield praises Finland and Brit aid

headline.main: BRITAIN IS WARNED EXPORTS ARE VITAL; Hoare Says Victory Depends on Ability to Buy War Supplies With Her Foreign Trade CHATFIELD PRAISES NAVY Asserts Command of the Sea Insures Holding of Empire-- Hints at New Allies Emphasizes Need for Economy Reviews Changes in Wales
